eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: URLTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows to read URL on Web browser exports of the game and manipulate URLs generally.
description: - Get the URL of the game page
- Get a specific part of a URL
- Get an search query parameter of a URL
- Modify a specific property of a URL

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the URL of the current game page.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get the URL of the web page
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentURL

eventsFunctions.description: Reloads the current web page.
eventsFunctions.name: Reload

eventsFunctions.description: Loads another page in place of the current one.
eventsFunctions.name: Redirect

eventsFunctions.description: Get an attribute from a URL.
eventsFunctions.name: URLAttribute

parameters.description: The URL to get the attribute from
parameters.name: URL

eventsFunctions.description: Gets a parameter of a URL query string.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get a parameter of a URL query string
eventsFunctions.name: URLQueryStringParameter

parameters.description: The URL to get a query string parameter from
parameters.name: URL

parameters.description: The query string parameter to get
parameters.name: param

eventsFunctions.description: Updates a specific part of a URL.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeURLAttribute

parameters.description: The new value of this attribute
parameters.name: val

eventsFunctions.description: Sets or replaces a query string parameter of a URL.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change a get parameter of a URL
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeURLQueryStringParameter

parameters.description: The query string parameter to update
parameters.name: param

parameters.description: The new value of the query string parameter
parameters.name: val

eventsFunctions.description: Removes a query string parameter from an URL.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remove a get parameter of an URL
eventsFunctions.name: RemoveURLQueryStringParameter

parameters.description: The query string parameter to remove
parameters.name: param

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedHTTP
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An extension to create HTTP requests with more advanced settings than the built-in "Network request" action, like specifying headers or bypassing CORS.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: An extension to create HTTP requests with more advanced settings than the built-in "Network request" action, like specifying headers or bypassing CORS.

eventsFunctions.description: Creates a template for your request. All requests must be made from a request template.
eventsFunctions.name: CreateRequest

parameters.description: URL the request will be sent to
parameters.name: URL

eventsFunctions.description: Creates a new request template with all the attributes from an existing one.
eventsFunctions.name: CopyRequest

eventsFunctions.description: The HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRequestMethod
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set HTTP method of request _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: the HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestMethod

eventsFunctions.description:
Defines to what extent the results of the request is can/must be cached. When cached, instead of sending a request to the server, the browser will avoid making a real request to the server and will use a previous response given by the server for the same request.

The server also has a say in this via the Cache-Control header.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRequestCache
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set HTTP caching strategy of request _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.longDescription: Learn more about what each caching strategy does [on the MDN page for cache](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/cache).
parameters.name: Cache

eventsFunctions.description: the HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestCache

eventsFunctions.description: The HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRequestBody
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set HTTP method of request _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the body of an HTTP request to a JSON representation of a structure variable.
eventsFunctions.name: SetJSONRequestBody
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set body of request _PARAM1_ to contents of _PARAM2_ as JSON

eventsFunctions.description: Sets the body of an HTTP request to a form data representation of a structure variable.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFormDataRequestBody
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set body of request _PARAM1_ to contents of _PARAM2_ as form data

events.comment: Merge form data with the form data of the request

eventsFunctions.description: the body of the HTTP request. Contains data to send to the server, ususally in plain text, JSON or FormData format. This cannot be set for GET requests.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestBody

eventsFunctions.description: The HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRequestHeader
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set HTTP method of request _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: an HTTP header to be sent with the request.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestHeader

eventsFunctions.description: The HTTP method of the request. GET is the default and what you should use if you are unsure which to pick. A request to a REST API endpoint may have a different effect depending on the method - refer to the documentation of the API you are calling to learn about the appropriate method to use.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRequestURL
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set HTTP method of request _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: the request template's target URL.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestURL

eventsFunctions.description:
CORS prevents most external websites from being queried with the browser's HTTP client, since the browser may be authenticated on that website and as such another website would be able to impersonate the player on that other website.

When the CORS Bypass is enabled, the request will be made from a server that is not authenticated anywhere and as such is not blocked by CORS, and it will share the response with your game. Note that as such, authentication cookies are ignored! If you own the REST API you are requesting, add CORS headers to your server instead of using this CORS Bypass.
eventsFunctions.name: UseCORSBypass

parameters.longDescription: The CORS Bypass server is offered for free by [arthuro555](https://twitter.com/arthuro555). Consider making a [donation](https://ko-fi.com/arthuro555) to help keep the CORS Bypass server running.
parameters.name: UseBypass

eventsFunctions.description: Checks whether or not CORS Bypass has been enabled for the request template.
eventsFunctions.name: IsUsingCORSBypass
eventsFunctions.sentence: CORS Bypass is enabled for request _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Executes the request defined by a request template.
eventsFunctions.name: ExecuteRequest
eventsFunctions.sentence: Execute request _PARAM1_ and store results in _PARAM2_

inlineCode: const advancedHTTP = (gdjs._advancedHTTP || (gdjs._advancedHTTP = { responses: new Map(), id: 1 }));
logger.error(`Couldn't execute request '${requestName}' - has it been properly initialized?`);
for (var x in obj) { return true; }
console.warn(`The request ${requestName} has both form data and a separate body - the body will be ignored and replaced by the form data.`);
// Cache makes sense only on the client. CF Workers does not support cache property on fetch anyways.
const { ok, status, headers, body } = await response.json();

parameters.description: Variable where to store the response to the request
parameters.name: Response

eventsFunctions.description: Checks whether the server marked the response as a success (status code 1XX/2XX), not as a failure (status code 4XX/5XX).
eventsFunctions.name: ResponseSuccess

eventsFunctions.description: the status code of the HTTP request (e.g. 200 if succeeded, 404 if not found, etc).
eventsFunctions.name: ResponseStatusCode

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the status text for a response. For example, for a response with the status code 404, the status text will be "Not Found".
eventsFunctions.name: ResponseStatusText

parameters: "{\"100\":\"Continue\",\"101\":\"Switching Protocols\",\"102\":\"Processing\",\"200\":\"OK\",\"201\":\"Created\",\"202\":\"Accepted\",\"203\":\"Non-Authoritative Information\",\"204\":\"No Content\",\"205\":\"Reset Content\",\"206\":\"Partial Content\",\"207\":\"Multi-Status\",\"226\":\"IM Used\",\"300\":\"Multiple Choices\",\"301\":\"Moved Permanently\",\"302\":\"Found\",\"303\":\"See Other\",\"304\":\"Not Modified\",\"305\":\"Use Proxy\",\"307\":\"Temporary Redirect\",\"308\":\"Permanent Redirect\",\"400\":\"Bad Request\",\"401\":\"Unauthorized\",\"402\":\"Payment Required\",\"403\":\"Forbidden\",\"404\":\"Not Found\",\"405\":\"Method Not Allowed\",\"406\":\"Not Acceptable\",\"407\":\"Proxy Authentication Required\",\"408\":\"Request Timeout\",\"409\":\"Conflict\",\"410\":\"Gone\",\"411\":\"Length Required\",\"412\":\"Precondition Failed\",\"413\":\"Payload Too Large\",\"414\":\"URI Too Long\",\"415\":\"Unsupported Media Type\",\"416\":\"Range Not Satisfiable\",\"417\":\"Expectation Failed\",\"418\":\"I'm a teapot\",\"422\":\"Unprocessable Entity\",\"423\":\"Locked\",\"424\":\"Failed Dependency\",\"426\":\"Upgrade Required\",\"428\":\"Precondition Required\",\"429\":\"Too Many Requests\",\"431\":\"Request Header Fields Too Large\",\"451\":\"Unavailable For Legal Reasons\",\"500\":\"Internal Server Error\",\"501\":\"Not Implemented\",\"502\":\"Bad Gateway\",\"503\":\"Service Unavailable\",\"504\":\"Gateway Time-out\",\"505\":\"HTTP Version Not Supported\",\"506\":\"Variant Also Negotiates\",\"507\":\"Insufficient Storage\",\"511\":\"Network Authentication Required\",\"1xx\":\"**Informational**\",\"2xx\":\"**Successful**\",\"3xx\":\"**Redirection**\",\"4xx\":\"**Client Error**\",\"5xx\":\"**Server Error**\",\"7xx\":\"**Developer Error**\"}"

eventsFunctions.description: one of the HTTP headers included in the server's response.
eventsFunctions.name: ResponseHeader

eventsFunctions.description: Reads the body sent by the server, and store it as a string in a variable.
eventsFunctions.name: ReadResponseText
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read body of response _PARAM1_ into _PARAM2_ as text

inlineCode: const advancedHTTP = (gdjs._advancedHTTP || (gdjs._advancedHTTP = { responses: new Map(), id: 1 }));

logger.error(`Couldn't read the body of a request. Either an invalid request has passed, or the body has already been disposed of. The body must be read within 10 seconds of the request succeeding, as it will then be disposed of.`);
logger.error(`An error occured while reading the body of a request: ${e}`)

parameters.description: Variable where to write the body contents into
parameters.name: Body

eventsFunctions.description: Reads the body sent by the server, parses it as JSON and stores the resulting structure in a variable.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: jack, DHsoftware, @Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Iframe
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create or delete an iframe to embed websites.
description: This extension allows you to set up and create Iframes to show websites on your game.
For security reasons on browsers, some websites can be limited if the host and the iFrame do not have the same origin.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a new Iframe to embed a website inside the game.
eventsFunctions.name: Create
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create Iframe _PARAM1_ at position _PARAM5_:_PARAM6_, width: _PARAM3_, height: _PARAM4_, url: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Delete the specified Iframe.
eventsFunctions.name: Delete

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId
